remarks: Dirichlet's theorem: there are infinitely many primes in any arithmetic progression coprime to ` N ` .  Theorem 9.4.1 of [Shapiro], p. 375.  See ~ http://metamath-blog.blogspot.com/2016/05/dirichlets-theorem.html for an informal exposition.  This is Metamath 100 proof #48.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-May-2016.)
statement:
dirith $p |- ( ( N e. NN /\ A e. ZZ /\ ( A gcd N ) = 1 ) -> { p e. Prime | N || ( p - A ) } ~~ NN ) $.
$d A p $.
$d N p $.
